metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12973 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.1, there is excessive iteration in the opj_t1_encode_cblks function of openjp2/t1.c. Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmp file. This issue is similar to CVE-2018-6616. It was discovered that OpenJPEG incorrectly handled certain BMP files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

notes.Note: ebarretto> Marking emscripten ignored as openjpeg2 code is only for test/example. eslerm> openjpeg upstream suggests using patches for CVE-2018-6616

criterions.comment: blender: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
emscripten: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ghostscript: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
